intro: Senecio levingei, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing shrub with silvery-gray foliage that helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that disperse easily by the wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Senecio levingei is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
